caption.p: Trait Divergence in Response to Treatment and Range in Canada Thistle.

Population least square means trait responses for change in leaf number between time point two to the end of experiment (leaves t4-t2) (A), final leaf number (leaves t4) (B), and final stem diameter (mm) (stem diameter t4) (C) to range and treatment in three common gardens between introduced North American (peach) and native European (turquoise) ranges of Canada thistle, along with 95% confidence intervals. Range and treatment were significant for all traits ( p < 0.05) (see Table 2).
